media.caption: President Kennedy casket rests atop the Lincoln catafalque in Capitol Rotunda

text.headline: Detail of the events around President John Fitzgerald Kennedy's death
text.text: Clipped from Wikipedia, a series of events of note around the 35th president of the USA's death represented in a timeline

media.caption: Kennedy arrives at Dallas Love Field airport

text.headline: Arrival in Dallas
text.text: Kennedy, his wife Jacqueline, and the rest of the presidential entourage arrived at Love Field in northwest Dallas aboard Air Force One after a very short flight from nearby Carswell Air Force Base, west of Fort Worth

media.caption: Frame 150 from the Zapruder film. Kennedy's limousine has just turned onto Elm Street, moments before the first shot, and the President is apparently waving.

text.headline: Kennedy shot
text.text: President Kennedy and Texas Governor John Connally are shot at 12:30 p.m. CST (18:30 UTC) in Dealey Plaza, Dallas, Texas. They are rushed to Parkland Memorial Hospital, where Kennedy is pronounced dead at 1:00 p.m. CST (19:00 UTC). Lee Harvey Oswald is arrested and charged with the murder. Oswald is shot and killed two days later by nightclub owner Jack Ruby.

media.caption: Texas Theatre, in Dallas, Texas, March 19, 2006

text.headline: Lee Harvey Oswald arrested
text.text: t Lee Harvey Oswald arrested at 'Texas Theatre' in Oak Lawn after ducking into the premises without paying and being reported to police by a member of staff

media.caption: Lyndon B. Johnson taking the oath of office aboard Air Force One at Love Field Airport
media.credit: An employee of the Executive Office of the President of the United States

text.headline: Lyndon B. Johnson sworn in as 36th president
text.text: Vice President Lyndon B. Johnson succeeds to the Presidency and is sworn in aboard Air Force One.

media.caption: Casket of U.S. President John F. Kennedy, in East Room of the White House
media.credit: A work prepared by an officer or employee of the United States Government

text.headline: Kennedy lies in repose - White House
text.text: Kennedy lies in repose in the White House East Room for a period of 24 hours. At 4:45 pm, President Johnson issues Proclamation 3561, declaring November 25, the day of the funeral service, to be a national day of mourning.

text.headline: Oswald shot
text.text: As live television cameras were covering his transfer from the city jail to the county jail, Oswald was fatally shot in the basement of Dallas Police Headquarters by Dallas nightclub operator Jack Ruby

media.caption: John F. Kennedy lying in state November 24-25, 1963
media.credit: An employee of the Architect of the Capitol

text.headline: Kennedy lies in state - US Capitol building
text.text: Kennedy lies in state for a period of 18 hours. NBC broadcasts live uninterrupted coverage of people passing through the Capitol rotunda during the overnight hours.

media.caption: &qt;Here Rested The Remains Of President Kennedy&qt; set in the the floor in front of the altar of Saint Matthew's Cathedral in Washington, D.C.

text.headline: Kennedy's funeral service
text.text: Kennedy's funeral service is held. Representatives from over 90 countries attend the ceremony.

media.caption: Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy and Robert F. Kennedy walk away from JFK's casket

text.headline: Kennedy's burial
text.text: President Kennedy is laid to rest at Arlington National Cemetery. Upon the request of the now-former First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy on the day before, an eternal flame, inspired by the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, known later as the John F. Kennedy Eternal Flame, is set up by the United States Army Corps of Engineers, and first lit by Mrs. Kennedy.
